roleset.name: propel projectile

example.name: all args
example.text: WHEN HURRICANE Hugo careened through the Caribbean and the Atlantic coast states, it downed electric and telephone lines, shot coconuts through cottage rooftops, shattered windows and uprooted thousands of lives.
example.arg: WHEN HURRICANE Hugo careened through the Caribbean and the Atlantic coast states,

example.name: unmentioned projectiles
example.text: When the smoke cleared, six people were dead (three from heart attacks), and everyone wondered what in the world they were shooting at *trace*.

example.name: weird kind of target
example.text: People are shooting for a dream.

example.name: nominal rel: shot; metaphorical goal, within LVC
example.text: I believe we have to take a shot at getting as much done as we can through the court.
example.arg: at getting as much done as we can through the court.

example.name: nominal rel: shot; unmentioned projectiles, literal/concrete
example.text: Adam Scott, of Australia, left, celebrates his shot to the 13th green.

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'shoot' based on sentences in wsj. Updated by Julia, 11/2010.Member of Vncls throw-17.1-1. (from shoot-v.01)

SHOT-N NOTES: Rolest based on verb entry shoot.01, although this verb seemed to be mostly a literal usage, whereas the noun seems to be primarily metaphorical. Corresponds to Vncls throw-17.1-1. (from shot-n.01)
SHOT-N NOTES: Seems doubtful mention of projectile will appear unless the rel is "shooting". Thing shot tends to be understood when it exists.

roleset.name: kill with gun; Event where weapons are fired; firing a gun

example.name: just corpse
example.text: Most of the cases have been in California, where one agent was stabbed and another was shot and killed *trace*.

example.name: friendly fire
example.text: ``Conservatives shoot their own,'' he says.

example.name: with explicit wound
example.text: The first time, he was shot in the hand as he chased the robbers outside.
example.arg: as he chased the robbers outside.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG2
example.text: It can send a fighter squadron to strafe terrorist hideouts in the Bekaa Valley , but ca n't shoot Abu Nidal .

example.name: Who doesn't love a good turkey shoot?
example.text: The county is not holding its annual turkey shoot this year.

example.name: nominal rel: shooting
example.text: Seattle shooting of Jews

example.name: Nominal rel: shooting
example.text: The only thing that is indicative of his shooting her in the head, is the scene previous to her dying, in which she spins the p90 around.

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: Member of Vncls poison-42.2. (from shoot-v.02)
SHOOT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry shoot.02 (kill with gun), OntoNotes sense grouping shoot.02; maps to VN class poison-42.2. Framed by Claire. (from shoot-n.01)
SHOOTING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, shoot-v.02. Corresponds to VNcls poison-42.2. (from shooting.01-n)
SHOOT-N NOTES: The shooter may never appear, be careful to distinguish sponsors/possessors of the event from actual shooters.

roleset.name: record on film; Event where photographers shoot pictures

role.descr: medium: photo, video, hi-def, color, etc

example.name: shoot film
example.text: In 1976, as a film student at the Purchase campus of the State University of New York, Mr. Lane shot ``A Place in Time,'' a 36-minute black-and-white film about a sketch artist, a man of the streets.
example.arg: as a film student at the Purchase campus of the State University of New York,
``A Place in Time,'' a 36-minute black-and-white film about a sketch artist, a man of the streets.

example.name: Fashion as subject, modifier of shoot
example.text: They are flying the models to Barbados for a fashion shoot.

example.name: Medium as modifier of shoot
example.text: The photographer is away this weekend on a photo shoot.

example.name: nominal rel: shot; LVC
example.text: Yea I 'm in the Philly area ... Basically the song would be nothing major just get a couple shots of different scenes with me and my friend rapping
example.arg: of different scenes with me and my friend rapping

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from shoot-v.03)
SHOOT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry shoot.03, OntoNotes sense grouping shoot.03. Framed by Claire (from shoot-n.02)
SHOT-N NOTES: (from shot-n.02)
Watch for arg2-manner adverbials: shoot in black-and-white, for example.

roleset.name: move very rapidly

example.name: usually shoot up
example.text: The Dow industrials shot up 23 points in the opening hour, at least in part because of buy programs generated by stock-index arbitrage, a form of program trading involving futures contracts.
example.arg: at least in part because of buy programs generated by stock-index arbitrage, a form of program trading involving futures contracts.

example.name: sometimes down
example.text: In particular, the prices of gold and other precious-metals stocks shoot up and down, but the stocks tend to have low betas because their moves are not market-inspired.
example.arg: the prices of gold and other precious-metals stocks

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: No Vncls. (from shoot-v.06)

roleset.name: loose wildly

example.name: ARG1 and ARG0
example.text: The city of Khan Younes had witnessed on the third of last July a similar incident , when the girl , Amani Al Raqab , died by a bullet that hit her by mistake from a revolver her brother was shooting off on his wedding day .

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: I really thought this would occur in wsj. (from shoot-v.04)

roleset.name: cause to not fly

example.name: instrumental subject
example.text: ``Ideas are going over borders, and there's no SDI ideological weapon that *trace*-1 can shoot them down,'' he told a group of Americans at the U.S. Embassy on Wednesday.

example.name: agentive subject
example.text: As a result, Ireland didn't spurn the Soviets after they shot down a Korean Air Lines jetliner over the Sea of Japan in 1983, though it suspended direct Moscow-Shannon flights for two months.

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: (from shoot-v.05)

roleset.name: answer

example.name: maybe hearer can't occur
example.text: And when he's told ``Try a little tenderness,'' he shoots back ``I'm going home to try a little linguine.''
example.arg: when he's told ``Try a little tenderness,''
``I'm going home to try a little linguine.''

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: (from shoot-v.07)

roleset.name: inject a drug into a vein

role.descr: Entity injecting the drug (usually the drug user)
entity being given the drug, if separate from arg0

example.name: all args
example.text: He said that Rodriguez shot him up with heroin and that he next remembers waking up at the hospital.

example.name: args 0, 1 (the most common arrangment)
example.text: What is with this rash of folks who shoot up heroin , in their cars , and then try to drive ?

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from shoot-v.08)

roleset.name: shoot 'em up, with guns

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: All your pro-war and *PRO* shoot 'em up buddies would have loved it .

roleset.note: SHOOT-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls. (from shoot-v.09)

roleset.name: gunfight

example.text: The city was the location of the wounding and capture of murderer Richard Wayne Snell in 1984, following his shootout with local police.

roleset.note: SHOOTOUT-N NOTES: Added automatically by Julia. Related to shoot.xml (from shootout.10-n)

roleset.name: exhausted, worn out

role.descr: causer of exhaustion, being worn out

example.name: arg1
example.text: Not earlier haha , just for 10 , I 'm shot I thought we opened at 10 but we open at 11

roleset.note: SHOT-J NOTES: Added by JUlia based on SMS. (from shot.01-j)

roleset.name: drink a small glass of liquid in a single backwards motion

example.name: arg1
example.text: He did a shot of wheatgrass
